Package com.github.m5c.livepoll.controllers

Class PollController

java.lang.Object
com.github.m5c.livepoll.controllers.PollController
@RestController
public class PollController
extends Object
REST Controller to register votes and retreive stats from backend.
Author:
Maximilian Schiedermeier

  • Constructor Details

    • PollController

      @Autowired public PollController​(QrImageGenerator qrImageGenerator, LocalResourceEncoder localResourceEncoder, LocalIpResolver localIpResolver, PollManager pollManager)
      Bean constructor.
      Parameters:
      qrImageGenerator - as the generator to be used for the creation of QR BitMatrix objects from resource strings.
      localResourceEncoder - as the encoder to be used to generate URI strings for vote option resources.
      localIpResolver - asa helper tool to look up the own LAN IP address of this webservice.
      pollManager - as the manager object that indexes all active polls.

  • Method Details

    • registerVote

      @GetMapping("/polls/{pollid}/options/{option}") public String registerVote​(@PathVariable("pollid") String pollId, @PathVariable("option") String option)
      An actual endpoint, referenced by generated QR code. Note using Get operation here is a clear violation to the REST style, but since we want to support vote by QR scanning it has to be GET (default HTTP method for browser resource access).
      Parameters:
      pollId - as the unique identifier of the poll for which we want to register a vote
      option - as the clients vote option submitted for this call
      Returns:
      string confirming the successful registration of the received ballot

    • getVoteAmount

      @GetMapping("/polls/{pollid}/outcome/{option}") public int getVoteAmount​(@PathVariable("pollid") String pollId, @PathVariable("option") String option, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      REST endpoint to look up amount of votes per option. Endpoint is better than static rendering on server side. Only accessible from localhost.
      Parameters:
      pollId - as the unique identifier of the poll for which we want to register a vote
      option - as the clients vote option submitted for this call
      request - as the http connection meta bundle, providing information on the sender
      Returns:
      the amount of votes registered so far for the specified vote and option

    • createPoll

      @PostMapping(value="/polls", consumes="application/json; charset=utf-8") public String createPoll​(@RequestBody Poll poll, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request) throws IOException, com.google.zxing.WriterException
      REST endpoint to create a new poll, based on the options provided as body payload. * Expects a poll object in request body, serialized as json, e.g.: {"topic":"Are cats cooler than dogs","optionVotes":{"No":0,"Yes":0}}
      Parameters:
      poll - as request body with all input details required to create the new poll
      request - as http servlet meta info object, providing information about client origin
      Returns:
      id of the newly created poll.
      Throws:
      IOException - in case the implicit lookup of the pwn webapps LAN ip failed.
      com.google.zxing.WriterException - in case the writing of a QR png file to the file system failed.

    • createPoll

      @DeleteMapping("/polls/{pollid}") public void createPoll​(@PathVariable("pollid") String pollId, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Rest endpoint to close a repviously opened poll.
      Parameters:
      pollId - as the identifier of the poll.
      request - as the http request needed to dermine the request origin.
